results.title: A Case study in mechanism (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Open University, BBC-TV and David Jackson
results.brief_description: An examination of the benzyne mechanism for nucleophilic aromatic substitution. Queries whether SN1 or SN2 mechanisms for nucleophilic substitution at a saturated carbon atom can be applied at an unsaturated or aromatic carbon atom. Looks at evidence for a modified version of the SN2 mechanism.

results.title: A Case of eggs
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Daisy Bellefeuille, John Smith and Bernard Devlin
results.brief_description: This is a fast-moving spoof centred around Bruno, the moonlighter who despairs over his striking hens; Dean Goodspeak who hires Frances and Rita, of the Sisters of Detective Agency, to investigate the erratic behaviour of scientist Dr Morrow, a mysterious stranger; and David, the academic drop-out who is nursing a broken heart on his boat. An intriguing mystery story with an “all’s well that ends well” finish. Cast includes Peter Haworth, Micki Mansel, Jo Kirkpatrick and Bill Reiter. Packaged for Teaching English as a Second Language.

results.title: A Case for shiftwork?
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: The case for and against shiftwork in industry. The film follows the investigation of a textile factory by a visiting consultant who produces a prima facie case for shiftwork while flashbacks show it was successfully introduced in other factories. Discussion with management and shop floor illuminate various systems of shiftwork and the organizational and human problems involved in its application.

results.title: A Case for handling
results.creator_credit: Greenpark Productions, Humphrey Swingler and Peter M Plaskitt
results.brief_description: Under the guidance of a consultant, a foundry adopts numerous materials-handling devices; as a result of speeding the flow of castings from one point to another and using now redundant labourers on productive semi-skilled tasks, output increased by 20%. Although mainly concerned with the re-conversion of one factory, the film shows a wide range of materials-handling methods in other industries, including the use of cranes, lifting blocks, runways, conveyors, unit loads, palletization etc.

results.title: A Career in nursing
results.brief_description:
Presents an overview of nursing training in Australia and gives a general outline of what is involved in each of the three years of training required for qualifications as a nursing sister. Points out avenuyes open after qualification.
NB: Out of date information.

results.title: A Career in hotels and restaurants
results.brief_description: The hotel and restaurant business as a career: a visit by two young people to a hotel where the manager greets them and shows them all the departments, explaining the background for every job and the prospects for entrants. Encourages school leavers to ask if they too can visit a local hotel and look behind the scenes.

results.title: A Career in commercial television
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios and Tony Wellington
results.brief_description: Looks at the administrative, engineering and production aspects of commercial television, concentrating in particular on production. Stresses the limited opportunities available in this field and how most people in production commence work at the bottom rung of the production ladder. Narrated by Roger Climpson. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Career in bricklaying
results.creator_credit: Academy Film Productions and Ronald Mason
results.brief_description: This film emphasizes the positive aspects of work in bricklaying. As in most career films the less-favourable side of the work is omitted. Bricklayers are shown learning the trade, and the application of bricklaying skills is depicted in various constructions including ornamental brickwork, arches, and brickwork in high-rise buildings. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Career in accountancy
results.creator_credit: Artransa Park Studios, Garry Blackledge and Richard Wallace
results.brief_description: Looks at three young people working in the field of accountancy and notes their reasons for choosing accountancy as a career as well as the range of options open to them. Also considers the role played by the Australian Society of Accountants. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Call from Malaysia
results.creator_credit: United Nations Television and Gilbert Lauzun
results.brief_description: We follow the efforts of a young Sarawak villager as he learns to participate in broadcasting, telephony, aviation and other modern occupations required in Malaysia (1967). Six million people living on countless islands and one large peninsula are now united in the Federation of Malaysia and the agencies of the United Nations are at work helping them build a modern and effective country.
